item.title: Using Emacs's ansi-term with ZSH
item.description: Emacs has a million and one shells which you can run interactively from within the editor. When my login shell was set to ZSH though - and I was running Emacs on OS X, none of the terminal emulators built into Emacs was could display ANSI escape codes correctly. Solution which worked for me was described on StackOverflow and required: adding the following snippet somewhere in the init config: ;; Use Emacs terminfo, not system terminfo (setq system-uses-terminfo nil) obtaining a copy of eterm-color.
